perturbation.original_text: You agree that the initial franchise fee represents payment for the initial grant of the Franchise rights and license granted herein, shall be fully earned upon execution of this Agreement, and the said fee will not be refunded under any circumstances unless otherwise specifically set forth herein. You must find a suitable Center site within 90 days of signing the Franchise Agreement, unless we mutually agree otherwise. If we cannot agree on a Center location, within 4 months, we may a) extend your search time, b) exchange your territory, or c) terminate your Franchise and refund up to 70% of your Franchise Fee, at our sole discretion. There are no refunds under any other circumstances.
perturbation.changed_text: You agree that the initial franchise fee represents payment for the initial grant of the Franchise rights and license granted herein, shall be fully earned upon execution of this Agreement, and the said fee will not be refunded under any circumstances.
perturbation.explanation: This omission removes the franchisee's right to a potential refund of a portion of the franchise fee if a suitable location cannot be found. Many state franchise laws (including those in Texas, where the agreement is governed) require specific disclosures and potential refunds under certain circumstances. Removing this refund provision creates a legal risk, as it may conflict with state franchise regulations designed to protect franchisees.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State Franchise Laws (e.g., Texas Business and Commerce Code, Chapter 14)

perturbation.original_text: You shall procure and maintain in full force and effect during the term of this Agreement, at Your expense, insurance policies written by an insurance company satisfactory to AIRSOPURE in accordance with standards and specifications set forth in the Operations Manual or otherwise by AIRSOPURE in writing. Such policies shall name AIRSOPURE as an additional insured and shall include, at a minimum: A. Comprehensive general liability insurance in the amount of $1,000,000.00. B. Comprehensive automobile liability insurance, including collision, comprehensive, medical and liability to satisfy state law requirements. C. Additional coverage's and higher policy limits may be required from time to time by AIRSOPURE.
perturbation.changed_text: You shall procure and maintain in full force and effect during the term of this Agreement, at Your expense, insurance policies written by an insurance company satisfactory to AIRSOPURE in accordance with standards and specifications set forth in the Operations Manual or otherwise by AIRSOPURE in writing. Such policies shall name AIRSOPURE as an additional insured and shall include, at a minimum: B. Comprehensive automobile liability insurance, including collision, comprehensive, medical and liability to satisfy state law requirements. C. Additional coverage's and higher policy limits may be required from time to time by AIRSOPURE.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'Comprehensive general liability insurance in the amount of $1,000,000.00' eliminates a specific, substantial insurance requirement. Many states mandate that businesses carry specific minimum amounts of liability coverage to protect consumers and third parties. By omitting this mandatory coverage, the franchise agreement becomes non-compliant. This creates a **legal contradiction** with state laws that mandate specific minimum coverage amounts for commercial liability insurance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State Commercial Liability Insurance Laws (e.g., Texas Insurance Code)

perturbation.original_text: A. THE PARTIES AGREE TO SUBMIT ANY CLAIM, CONTROVERSY OR DISPUTE ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT (AND ATTACHMENTS) OR THE RELATIONSHIP CREATED BY THIS AGREEMENT TO NON-BINDING MEDIATION PRIOR TO BRINGING SUCH CLAIM, CONTROVERSY OR DISPUTE IN A COURT. THE MEDIATION SHALL BE CONDUCTED THROUGH EITHER AN INDIVIDUAL MEDIATOR OR A MEDIATOR APPOINTED BY A MEDIATION SERVICES ORGANIZATION OR BODY, EXPERIENCED IN THE MEDIATION OF DISPUTES IN THE AIR PURIFICATION SERVICE BUSINESS, AGREED UPON BY THE PARTIES AND, FAILING SUCH AGREEMENT WITHIN A REASONABLE PERIOD OF TIME AFTER EACH PARTY HAS NOTIFIED THE OTHER OF ITS DESIRE TO SEEK MEDIATION OF ANY CLAIM CONTROVERSY OR DISPUTE (NOT TO EXCEED 15 DAYS), THROUGH THE AMERICAN ARBITRATION ASSOCIATION IN ACCORDANCE THE RULES GOVERNING MEDIATION, AT AIRSOPURE CORPORATE HEADQUARTERS IN DALLAS, TEXAS. THE COSTS AND EXPENSES OF MEDIATION, INCLUDING COMPENSATION AND EXPENSES OF THE MEDIATOR, SHALL BE BORNE BY THE PARTIES EQUALLY. IF THE PARTIES ARE UNABLE TO RESOLVE THE CLAIM, CONTROVERSY OR DISPUTE 90 DAYS 17 AFTER THE MEDIATOR HAS BEEN APPOINTED, THEN EITHER PARTY MAY SUBMIT SUCH CLAIM, CONTROVERSY OR DISPUTE TO A COURT IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION 19.B.
perturbation.changed_text: A. THE PARTIES AGREE THAT ANY CLAIM, CONTROVERSY OR DISPUTE ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT (AND ATTACHMENTS) OR THE RELATIONSHIP CREATED BY THIS AGREEMENT WILL BE SUBMITTED DIRECTLY TO A COURT IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION 19.B.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the mediation clause entirely, the contract eliminates an alternative dispute resolution process. While not always legally required, some jurisdictions favor or even mandate mediation for certain types of disputes before litigation. This removal, while not a direct violation of a mandatory law in Texas for this specific type of agreement, increases the legal risk by bypassing a potentially quicker and cheaper resolution method, which could be seen negatively by courts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially impacts enforcement under principles favoring Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) in Texas civil procedure.
